issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: If the mobile sdk folder is not writable, the sdk install command errors. Try to detect and gracefully fail.
fields.summary: CLI: Make sure sdk folder is writable when installing an sdk

comments.body:
Verified fixed on:
Mac OSX 10.9 Mavericks
Titanium Studio, build: 3.2.0.201311160316
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.0.v20131117001643
CLI: 3.2.0-alpha
Alloy: 1.3.0

Verified using test case provided in comments and SDK successfully installed to writable folder and an error message is displayed for folders that have no write access.
Closing.
